bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 15, 1890

div1.p: Lazear writes about sightseeing in Paris and the opera.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 15, 1890
div1.p:
We have concluded
to remain at Paris until Monday
It would have hurried us to get off
to-day. It turns out that this
is a holiday of some kind. I
should have got a letter from
you but I find that the bank
is closed.

Since I last wrote I have seen
quite a number of things. On Wednesday
I went to Versailles and straight
remained there nearly all day.

There was a great deal there
that was very interesting.

Yesterday I went to the Pantheon.
It is a very fine building. I got a
picture of it which however does
not do it justice. I also went
to the Hotel des Invalides where
I saw the tomb of Napoleon and
and a museum of arms and armour
of all ages. I afterwards went
to the Jardin d'Acclimatation
which is a part of the Bois de
Boulogne. It is a zoological
and botanical garden carried
on with an object of breeding
and acclimatizing certain animals
and plants. Besides the usual
wild animals they have horses,
dogs, poultry etc.

To-day I am going out to Pere La
Chaise.

Yesterday afternoon I went to the
cemetery of Pere Lachaise. It is very
different from our cemeteries. It is
packed full of box-like tombs and
there is no lawn at all. I saw
the graves of a great many famous
people.

In the evening I stood in the top
gallery at the opera where they were
playing L'Africanse. It was sung
beautifully. The work of the orchestra
was grand. At the beginning of
the desert scene at the last, just after
the curtain rises the orchestra plays
a kind of overture before anyone
appears on the stage. I never
heard anything like the way this
was played. The harmony was grand
and it came out like one sound,

Norris and I are going to the
Catacombs to-day.
